item.title: Natural gas prices are low, but your monthly gas bill is up. Here's why
item.description: Gas utility bills are rising even though natural gas prices are down. That's because a much larger share of your gas bill now goes to infrastructure instead of fuel.

item.title: Amid shutdown, Trump administration guts department overseeing special education
item.description: Multiple sources tell NPR that, as part of the Trump administration's latest reduction-in-force, the U.S. Department of Education has gutted the office that handles special education.

item.description: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt won the Nobel memorial prize in economics Monday for their research on how technological innovation fuels economic growth and creative destruction.

item.title: In a major milestone, Hamas releases final group of living Israeli hostages
item.description: The release by Hamas of living Israeli hostages began an expected swap of hostages for prisoners. In turn, Israel will be releasing nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners and detainees as part of the ceasefire agreement.

item.title: U.S. measles cases continue to climb, with outbreaks across the country
